result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mercedes T Jackson

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.
ADA Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State. STC scheduled with notice required language.
Pre-trial conference on August 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol. 
Trial Judge - Br 2

09:24 AM Case re-called. Defendant appeared.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Court vacated previously-authorized warrant.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Mercedes T Jackson
Current: 1110 S 8th St Apt 7A, Minneapolis, MN 55404   (Effective: 06-30-2022)
Prior: 1110 S 8th, Minneapolis, MN 55404
09:19 AM Defendant did not appear.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant and copy of Complaint given to the Sheriff's Office to attempt to serve.
